ground_truth: The tall Bree folk loom over the nervous little hobbits as Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin make their way through the narrow streets, with tall buildings towering above them and lights glowing dimly from behind thick curtains. Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin come rushing in as Frodo attracts the innkeeper's attention. Sam watches Pippin rise unsteadily to his feet and head to the bar, while Sam indicates a brooding stranger who sits alone at a table in the far corner, smoking a curiously carved long-stemmed pipe and peering from beneath a travel-stained cowl with gleaming eyes. Frodo gestures to Butterbur while sitting at the bar and chatting with locals. Frodo leaps to his feet and pushes his way towards the bar, grabbing Pippin's sleeve and spilling his beer. Frodo is then pushed into the hobbit's room by Strider, who sheathes his sword with a slight smile playing on his lips. The gatekeeper comes out of his lodgings with a lantern and a look of fear on his face, approaching the closed gate with great apprehension. As the gatekeeper peers out of his peephole, the gate crashes down on him as four Ringwraiths ride into Bree, flying down the empty streets like horsemen of the apocalypse. The front door flies open, and the four Ringwraiths rush into the Prancing Pony with wicked swords drawn, while Butterbur hides behind his bar, trembling and sweating in terror. Pippin stirs slightly, then settles back to sleep. The door creaks open, and the four Ringwraiths silently slide into the hobbit's room, looming above each bed and raising their shining swords above the sleeping hobbits. Sam's eyes open wide as, in unison, the Ringwraiths stab the hobbits in a slashing, hacking frenzy. The Ringwraiths step back from the slashed beds in triumph, but a hacked blanket is pulled back to reveal nothing but a shredded pillow. The Ringwraiths shriek with rage as Sam sits up with a start, and another shredded pillow is revealed, causing more shrieks of rage. Pippin and Merry wake with a start, revealing that Sam, Merry, and Pippin have been sleeping on Strider's bed. Frodo stands next to Strider by the window, peering out nervously as furious Ringwraith screeches echo across the courtyard from the hobbits' room. Strider, Merry, Pippin, and Frodo march through a gloomy, overgrown forest as Frodo watches uneasily while Strider moves off into the cover of the trees, and Sam looks excited. Strider leads the hobbits through the gloom of the forest, then aerially leads Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin across the windswept moors. The hobbits suddenly stop and unstrap their knapsacks as Strider stops, casts a glance back at Sam, stares at Pippin blankly, then turns away, shaking his head. An apple is thrown to Merry, who deftly catches it, and another, aimed at Pippin, catches him on the forehead.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The high Bree people loom over the anxious small hobbits as Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin make their way through the tight roads, with high structures towering above them and lights glowing dimly from behind dense drapes. Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin come rushing in as Frodo attracts the innkeeper's regard. Sam observes Pippin rise unsteadily to his feet and head to the bar, while Sam points to a brooding outsider who sits alone at a table in the distant corner, smoking a curiously carved long-stemmed pipe and peering from beneath a travel-stained hood with gleaming eyes. Frodo signals to Butterbur while sitting at the bar and chatting with locals. Frodo jumps to his feet and pushes his way towards the bar, grabbing Pippin's sleeve and spilling his ale. Frodo is then pushed into the hobbit's room by Strider, who sheathes his blade with a slight smile playing on his lips. The gatekeeper comes out of his quarters with a lantern and a look of dread on his face, approaching the shut gate with great apprehension. As the gatekeeper peers out of his peephole, the gate crashes down on him as four Ringwraiths ride into Bree, flying down the vacant streets like horsemen of the apocalypse. The front door flies open, and the four Ringwraiths rush into the Prancing Pony with wicked blades drawn, while Butterbur hides behind his bar, shaking and sweating in terror. Pippin stirs slightly, then settles back to slumber. The door creaks open, and the four Ringwraiths silently slide into the hobbit's room, looming above each bed and raising their gleaming swords above the sleeping hobbits. Sam's eyes open wide as, in unison, the Ringwraiths stab the hobbits in a slashing, hacking frenzy. The Ringwraiths step back from the slashed beds in triumph, but a hacked blanket is pulled back to reveal nothing but a shredded cushion. The Ringwraiths shriek with fury as Sam sits up with a start, and another shredded cushion is revealed, causing more shrieks of fury. Pippin and Merry wake with a start, revealing that Sam, Merry, and Pippin have been slumbering on Strider's bed. Frodo stands next to Strider by the window, peering out anxiously as furious Ringwraith screeches echo across the courtyard from the hobbits' room. Strider, Merry, Pippin, and Frodo march through a somber, overgrown woodland as Frodo watches uneasily while Strider moves off into the cover of the trees, and Sam looks enthusiastic. Strider guides the hobbits through the gloom of the woodland, then aerially leads Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin across the windswept moors. The hobbits suddenly stop and unstrap their rucksacks as Strider stops, casts a glance back at Sam, stares at Pippin blankly, then turns away, shaking his head. An apple is thrown to Merry, who deftly catches it, and another, aimed at Pippin, catches him on the forehead.

Butterbur is gestured to by Frodo while the bar is sat at and locals are chatted with by him. The gatekeeper is approached by the closed gate with great apprehension as he comes out of his lodgings with a lantern and a look of fear on his face. As his peephole is peered out of by the gatekeeper, the gate crashes down on him as into Bree ride four Ringwraiths, flying down the empty streets like horsemen of the apocalypse. The front door is flung open, and the Prancing Pony is rushed into by the four Ringwraiths with wicked swords drawn, while Butterbur hides behind his bar, trembling and sweating in terror. Pippin stirs slightly, then settles back to sleep. The hobbit's room is slid silently into by the four Ringwraiths as the door creaks open, looming above each bed and raising their shining swords above the sleeping hobbits. Sam's eyes open wide as the hobbits are stabbed by the Ringwraiths in a slashing, hacking frenzy. The slashed beds are stepped back from by the Ringwraiths in triumph, but a shredded pillow is revealed as a hacked blanket is pulled back to reveal nothing. The Ringwraiths shriek with rage as a start is sat up by Sam, and another shredded pillow is revealed, causing more shrieks of rage. Pippin and Merry wake with a start, revealing that Strider's bed has been slept on by Sam, Merry, and Pippin. Next to Strider, Frodo stands by the window, nervously peering out as furious Ringwraith screeches echo across the courtyard from the hobbits' room. Through a gloomy, overgrown forest, Strider, Merry, Pippin, and Frodo march as Frodo watches uneasily while the trees are moved into the cover of by Strider, and Sam looks excited. Through the gloom of the forest, the hobbits are led by Strider, then Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin are aerially led across the windswept moors. The hobbits suddenly stop and unstrap their knapsacks as Sam is glanced back at by Strider, who stares at Pippin blankly, then turns away, shaking his head. An apple is thrown to Merry by someone, who deftly catches it, and another is aimed at Pippin and catches him on the forehead.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The towering Bree folk loom over the nervous hobbits—Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin—as they navigate the narrow streets, with tall buildings and dim lights behind thick curtains. They rush in, drawing the innkeeper's attention. Sam watches Pippin head to the bar and points out a mysterious stranger in the corner, smoking a carved pipe and peering from a travel-stained cowl. Frodo, chatting at the bar, leaps up, grabs Pippin's sleeve, and spills his beer. Strider pushes Frodo into the hobbit's room, sheathing his sword with a smile. The fearful gatekeeper, with a lantern, approaches the gate, which crashes as four Ringwraiths ride into Bree like horsemen of the apocalypse. The four Ringwraiths, swords drawn, storm the Prancing Pony, frightening Butterbur. As they enter the hobbit's room, they raise their swords over each bed. Sam's eyes widen as they slash the beds, revealing only pillows. The Ringwraiths shriek with rage, and Sam, Merry, and Pippin wake on Strider's bed. Frodo stands with Strider by the window, listening to the echoes. Strider leads the hobbits through a gloomy forest, Frodo uneasily watching Strider move into the trees, and Sam appears excited. They traverse the windswept moors, stopping to unstrap knapsacks. Strider glances back at Sam and Pippin, shaking his head. Merry catches an apple deftly, while one hits Pippin's forehead.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Tall Bree folk overshadow the hobbits, Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin, navigating narrow streets with towering buildings and dim lights. Entering, Frodo catches the innkeeper's eye. Sam sees Pippin stumble to the bar, noting a lone, brooding stranger with a carved pipe. Frodo gestures to Butterbur, chatting at the bar. Frodo then grabs Pippin’s sleeve, spilling his beer. Strider pushes Frodo into the hobbit's room, slightly smiling as he sheaths his sword. The gatekeeper, fearful, approaches the gate with a lantern, which is smashed by four Ringwraiths riding in. The Ringwraiths burst into the Prancing Pony with drawn swords as Butterbur hides in terror. Pippin stirs but sleeps. The Ringwraiths silently enter the hobbit's room, raising swords over the beds and stabbing in a frenzy. They step back triumphant, only to find shredded pillows. Furious, they shriek as Sam and the others wake on Strider's bed. Frodo and Strider, by the window, hear Ringwraith screeches echo. Strider and the hobbits traverse an overgrown forest, with Strider moving into the trees and Sam excited. Strider leads them through the forest and windswept moors. They stop, unstrapping packs, as Strider glances at Sam and Pippin. An apple thrown to Merry is caught, while another hits Pippin's forehead.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
The imposing figures of the tall Bree folk seem to loom ominously over the small, anxious hobbits—Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin—as they gingerly make their way through the narrow, winding streets. The tall buildings, standing like silent sentinels, tower high above them, with lights casting a dim glow from behind thick, concealing curtains. As Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin rush in, Frodo quickly manages to attract the attention of the innkeeper. Sam attentively observes Pippin as he rises unsteadily to his feet and makes his way toward the bar, while at the same time, Sam points out a brooding, mysterious stranger who sits alone, isolated at a table in the far corner. This stranger, with gleaming eyes, smokes a pipe carved with curious intricacy and peers out from beneath a travel-stained cowl. Meanwhile, Frodo gestures to Butterbur as he sits at the bar, engaging in light conversation with the locals. Suddenly, Frodo leaps to his feet and determinedly pushes his way toward the bar, inadvertently grabbing Pippin's sleeve and spilling his beer in the process. This moment of chaos transitions quickly as Frodo finds himself pushed into the hobbit's room by Strider, who, with a subtle smile gracing his lips, sheathes his sword. 

Outside, the gatekeeper emerges from his lodgings, carrying a lantern and bearing a look of profound fear on his face. He approaches the closed gate, filled with great apprehension. As he peers cautiously out of his peephole, the gate dramatically crashes down upon him as four ominous Ringwraiths ride swiftly into Bree, racing down the deserted streets like the terrifying horsemen of the apocalypse. The front door bursts open violently, and the four Ringwraiths, with their wicked swords drawn, rush into the Prancing Pony, prompting Butterbur to hide behind his bar, trembling and sweating with terror. Pippin stirs slightly from slumber but then settles back into a deep, peaceful sleep. The door to the hobbit's room creaks open slowly, and the four Ringwraiths glide silently into the room, looming ominously above each bed. They raise their shining swords high above the sleeping hobbits. Sam's eyes snap open wide, just as, in perfect unison, the Ringwraiths engage in a frenzied stabbing and slashing attack. 

The Ringwraiths, stepping back in apparent triumph from the now-slash beds, are met with a surprise as a hacked blanket is pulled back to reveal nothing but a shredded pillow. Their triumph quickly turns to rage, and they shriek with fury when Sam, startled, sits up abruptly, revealing yet another shredded pillow and inciting further shrieks of rage. Pippin and Merry awaken abruptly, realising that Sam, Merry, and Pippin have been safely sleeping on Strider's bed. Frodo stands beside Strider, near the window, nervously peering out as the furious screeches of the Ringwraiths echo ominously across the courtyard from the hobbits' room. 

Strider, leading Frodo, Merry, Pippin, and Sam, marches determinedly through a dark, overgrown forest. Frodo watches uneasily as Strider moves silently into the thick cover of the trees, while Sam, on the other hand, looks filled with excitement. Strider guides the hobbits through the gloom and shadows of the forest, and then, in an impressive aerial move, leads Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin across the vast, windswept moors. Suddenly, the hobbits come to a halt, unstrapping their knapsacks as they see Strider stop. Strider casts a knowing glance back at Sam, stares momentarily at Pippin with a blank expression, then turns away, shaking his head ever so slightly. An apple is tossed through the air towards Merry, who catches it deftly, while another flies toward Pippin, hitting him squarely on the forehead before he can react.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
The tall, commanding figures of the Bree folk, with their imposing stature, appear to loom ominously over the diminutive, anxious hobbits—Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin—as they gingerly and cautiously make their way through the narrow, winding streets of the town. The towering buildings, standing like silent, watchful sentinels, seem to rise high above them, with dim, subdued lights casting a faint glow from behind thick, concealing curtains. Upon entering, Frodo quickly manages to attract the attention of the innkeeper. Meanwhile, Sam attentively keeps an eye on Pippin, who rises unsteadily from his seat and makes his way towards the bar, all while Sam points out a brooding, enigmatic stranger who sits alone, isolated at a table in the far corner. This mysterious stranger, with eyes that gleam sharply, smokes a pipe carved with intricate and curious detail, peering out from beneath a travel-stained cowl. At the same time, Frodo gestures to Butterbur as he sits at the bar, engaging in lighthearted conversation with the local patrons. Suddenly, he leaps to his feet and determinedly pushes his way toward the bar, inadvertently grabbing Pippin's sleeve in the process, causing Pippin's beer to spill. This moment of chaos quickly transitions as Frodo finds himself hastily ushered into the hobbit's room by Strider, who, with a subtle, knowing smile gracing his lips, calmly sheathes his sword.

Outside, the gatekeeper emerges cautiously from his lodgings, holding a lantern and bearing a look of profound fear on his face. He approaches the closed gate, filled with a great sense of apprehension. As he peers cautiously out of his peephole, the gate crashes down dramatically upon him as four ominous Ringwraiths ride swiftly into Bree, racing with speed down the deserted streets like the terrifying horsemen of the apocalypse. The front door bursts open violently, and the four Ringwraiths, with their wicked swords drawn, rush into the Prancing Pony, prompting Butterbur to hide trembling and sweating with terror behind his bar. Pippin stirs slightly from his slumber but then settles back into a deep, peaceful sleep. The door to the hobbit's room creaks open slowly, allowing the four Ringwraiths to glide silently into the room, looming ominously above each bed. They raise their shining swords high above the forms thought to be sleeping hobbits. Sam's eyes snap open wide, just as, in perfect unison, the Ringwraiths engage in a frenzied attack of stabbing and slashing.

The Ringwraiths, stepping back in apparent triumph from the now-slash beds, are met with an unexpected surprise as the hacked blanket is pulled back to reveal nothing but a shredded pillow. Their moment of triumph swiftly turns to rage, and they shriek with fury when Sam, startled awake, sits up abruptly, revealing yet another shredded pillow and inciting further shrieks of rage. Pippin and Merry awaken abruptly, realizing that Sam, Merry, and Pippin have been safely sleeping on Strider's bed. Frodo stands by Strider, near the window, nervously peering out as the furious screeches of the Ringwraiths echo ominously across the courtyard from the hobbits' room.

Strider, leading the group of hobbits—Frodo, Merry, Pippin, and Sam—marches determinedly through a shadowy, overgrown forest. Frodo watches uneasily as Strider moves silently and expertly into the thick cover of the trees, while Sam, on the other hand, looks filled with growing excitement. Strider guides the hobbits carefully through the gloom and shadows of the dense forest, then impressively leads Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin across the vast, windswept moors. Suddenly, the hobbits come to a halt, unstrapping their knapsacks as they see Strider stop ahead. Strider casts a knowing glance back at Sam, stares momentarily at Pippin with a blank expression, then turns away, shaking his head ever so slightly. An apple is tossed through the air towards Merry, who catches it deftly, while another flies towards Pippin, hitting him squarely on the forehead before he has a chance to react.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The tall Bree folk cast imposing shadows over the nervous little hobbits as Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin navigate the narrow, winding streets, feeling dwarfed by the towering buildings whose dimly lit windows are shrouded by thick, heavy curtains. As they reach the inn, Frodo purposefully catches the innkeeper's eye, and the hobbits hurry inside with a sense of urgency. Sam pays close attention to Pippin, who rises unsteadily to his feet, sways slightly, and makes his way to the bar, while Sam nudges Frodo, indicating a brooding stranger seated alone in the far corner. This mysterious figure puffs thoughtfully on a curiously carved long-stemmed pipe, his gleaming eyes peeking out from under a travel-worn cowl. Meanwhile, Frodo sits at the bar, engaging in light banter with the locals, and gestures to Butterbur, signaling for attention. Suddenly, Frodo springs up from his seat and makes a beeline for the bar, weaving through patrons and reaching out to grab Pippin's sleeve, accidentally causing Pippin's beer to spill. Frodo's abrupt action is quickly followed by Strider's intervention; he guides Frodo into the hobbit's room, calmly sheathing his sword with a faint, knowing smile. Outside, the gatekeeper emerges nervously from his lodgings, his lantern casting jittery shadows as he approaches the closed gate with visible anxiety. He peers through the peephole, only to be startled as the gate crashes down under the force of four Ringwraiths who thunder into Bree, galloping down the deserted streets like spectral horsemen of the apocalypse. The commotion causes the front door to burst open, and the Ringwraiths storm into the Prancing Pony with wicked swords brandished, while Butterbur cowers behind his bar, shaking and drenched in sweat. In the meantime, Pippin shifts slightly in his sleep, then settles back into slumber. Quietly, the door to the hobbit's room creaks open, and the four Ringwraiths glide in, cloaked in darkness as they approach each bed, their swords poised ominously over the presumed sleeping forms. Sam's eyes snap open wide in horror as the Ringwraiths enact a vicious, slashing, hacking frenzy upon the beds. However, when they step back, triumphant, they uncover only shredded pillows beneath the hacked blankets. Enraged, the Ringwraiths shriek as their fury mounts, while Sam bolts upright, revealing another slashed pillow, prompting further cries of frustration. Both Pippin and Merry awaken with a jolt, confirming that Sam, Merry, and Pippin had been safely resting on Strider's bed. Elsewhere, Frodo stands alongside Strider by the window, his gaze darting nervously as the piercing shrieks of the Ringwraiths echo ominously across the courtyard, further fueling the tension. In the following scene, Strider, Merry, Pippin, and Frodo advance through a murky, overgrown forest. Strider moves with purpose into the cover of the trees, while Sam's excitement is barely contained. Leading the hobbits through the forest's gloom, Strider then guides Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin across open, windswept moors. Their progress halts suddenly as the hobbits pause to unstrap their knapsacks. Strider stops as well, casting a glance back at Sam, then looks at Pippin with a blank stare before turning away, shaking his head slightly. An apple is tossed to Merry, who catches it effortlessly, but when another apple is aimed at Pippin, it strikes him on the forehead, eliciting a surprised reaction.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin navigate the narrow, dimly-lit streets of Bree, feeling dwarfed by the looming Bree folk and towering buildings. They rush into the inn, where Frodo engages the innkeeper while Pippin wobbles to the bar and Sam notices a brooding stranger smoking a pipe. Frodo signals Butterbur and converses with locals at the bar before suddenly pulling Pippin away, causing a beer spill. Strider then ushers Frodo into the hobbit's room, smiling as he sheaths his sword. 

Meanwhile, the gatekeeper, gripped by fear, approaches the gate and is overtaken as four Ringwraiths crash into Bree and storm the Prancing Pony, causing Butterbur to hide in terror. The Ringwraiths silently enter the hobbits' room, attacking with their swords only to find shredded pillows instead of their targets, prompting them to shriek in rage. The commotion wakes Pippin, Merry, and Sam, who are revealed to have been sleeping elsewhere. Frodo and Strider stand watchfully by the window, listening to the Ringwraiths' furious screams.

Strider leads the hobbits through a dark, overgrown forest and across windswept moors. As they pause, Strider glances at Sam and Pippin, shaking his head before they continue. Merry catches an apple thrown his way, while another aimed at Pippin hits his forehead.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The tall Bree folk, known for their mixed ancestry of men and hobbit lineage, loom over the nervous little hobbits as Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin make their way through the narrow streets. These streets are part of Bree, one of the few places where hobbits and humans live together, with tall buildings towering above them and lights glowing dimly from behind thick curtains, contributing to the town's mysterious atmosphere. Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin come rushing in as Frodo attracts the innkeeper's attention. This innkeeper is Barliman Butterbur, a well-meaning but often forgetful man. Sam watches Pippin rise unsteadily to his feet and head to the bar, while Sam indicates a brooding stranger, known as Strider but whose true name is Aragorn, the heir of Isildur, who sits alone at a table in the far corner. Strider is smoking a curiously carved long-stemmed pipe, similar to those made by the Elves of Rivendell, and peering from beneath a travel-stained cowl with gleaming eyes. Frodo gestures to Butterbur while sitting at the bar and chatting with locals, many of whom are traders and travelers with tales from afar. Frodo leaps to his feet and pushes his way towards the bar, grabbing Pippin's sleeve and spilling his beer in the process. Frodo is then pushed into the hobbit's room by Strider, who sheathes his sword, a weapon of Elven make, with a slight smile playing on his lips, suggesting his confidence in handling danger. The gatekeeper, known in Bree as Harry, comes out of his lodgings with a lantern and a look of fear on his face, approaching the closed gate with great apprehension. As the gatekeeper peers out of his peephole, the gate crashes down on him as four Ringwraiths, also known as the Nazgûl, ride into Bree. These Ringwraiths are servants of the Dark Lord Sauron, and they fly down the empty streets like horsemen of the apocalypse. The front door flies open, and the four Ringwraiths rush into the Prancing Pony, a renowned inn with connections to many travelers, with wicked swords drawn, while Butterbur hides behind his bar, trembling and sweating in terror. Pippin stirs slightly, then settles back to sleep, unaware of the chaos. The door creaks open, and the four Ringwraiths silently slide into the hobbit's room, looming above each bed and raising their shining swords above the sleeping hobbits. Sam's eyes open wide as, in unison, the Ringwraiths stab the hobbits in a slashing, hacking frenzy. The Ringwraiths step back from the slashed beds in triumph, but a hacked blanket is pulled back to reveal nothing but a shredded pillow, a clever decoy. The Ringwraiths shriek with rage as Sam sits up with a start, and another shredded pillow is revealed, causing more shrieks of rage. Pippin and Merry wake with a start, revealing that Sam, Merry, and Pippin have been sleeping on Strider's bed, a strategic move by Strider to protect them. Frodo stands next to Strider by the window, peering out nervously as furious Ringwraith screeches echo across the courtyard from the hobbits' room. Strider, Merry, Pippin, and Frodo march through a gloomy, overgrown forest, which is part of the ancient and mysterious land known as the Old Forest. Frodo watches uneasily while Strider moves off into the cover of the trees, and Sam looks excited at the prospect of adventure. Strider leads the hobbits through the gloom of the forest, then aerially leads Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin across the windswept moors, an open and desolate landscape that stretches beyond Bree. The hobbits suddenly stop and unstrap their knapsacks as Strider stops, casts a glance back at Sam, who often surprises with his practicality, stares at Pippin blankly, then turns away, shaking his head. An apple is thrown to Merry, who deftly catches it, showcasing his agility, and another, aimed at Pippin, catches him on the forehead, highlighting Pippin's often unfortunate clumsiness.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: The tall Bree folk loom over the nervous little hobbits as Frodo Sam Merry and Pippin make their way through the narrow streets with tall buildings towering above them and lights glowing dimly from behind thick curtains. Frodo Sam Merry and Pippin come rushing in as Frodo attracts the innkeeper's attention. Sam watches Pippin rise unsteadily to his feet and head to the bar while Sam indicates a brooding stranger who sits alone at a table in the far corner smoking a curiously carved longstemmed pipe and peering from beneath a travelstained cowl with gleaming eyes Frodo gestures to Butterbur while sitting at the bar and chatting with locals. Frodo leaps to his feet and pushes his way towards the bar grabbing Pippin's sleeve and spilling his beer. Frodo is then pushed into the hobbit's room by Strider who sheathes his sword with a slight smile playing on his lips. The gatekeeper comes out of his lodgings with a lantern and a look of fear on his face approaching the closed gate with great apprehension. As the gatekeeper peers out of his peephole the gate crashes down on him as four Ringwraiths ride into Bree flying down the empty streets like horsemen of the apocalypse. The front door flies open and the four Ringwraiths rush into the Prancing Pony with wicked swords drawn while Butterbur hides behind his bar trembling and sweating in terror. Pippin stirs slightly then settles back to sleep. The door creaks open and the four Ringwraiths silently slide into the hobbit's room looming above each bed and raising their shining swords above the sleeping hobbits. Sam's eyes open wide as in unison the Ringwraiths stab the hobbits in a slashing hacking frenzy. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. The Ringwraiths step back from the slashed beds in triumph but a hacked blanket is pulled back to reveal nothing but a shredded pillow. The Ringwraiths shriek with rage as Sam sits up with a start and another shredded pillow is revealed causing more shrieks of rage. Pippin and Merry wake with a start revealing that Sam Merry and Pippin have been sleeping on Strider's bed. Frodo stands next to Strider by the window peering out nervously. as furious Ringwraith screeches echo across the courtyard from the hobbits' room. Strider Merry Pippin and Frodo march through a gloomy overgrown forest as Frodo watches uneasily while Strider moves off into the cover of the trees and Sam looks excited. Strider leads the hobbits through the gloom of the forest then aerially leads Frodo. Sam Merry and Pippin across the windswept moors. The hobbits suddenly stop and unstrap their knapsacks as Strider stops casts a glance back at. Sam stares at Pippin blankly then turns away shaking his head. An apple is thrown to Merry who deftly catches it and another aimed at Pippin catches him on the forehead.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: The tall Bree folk loom over the nervous little hobbits as Frodo Sam Merry and Pippin make their way through the narrow streets with tall buildings towering above them and lights glowing dimly from behind thick curtains. Frodo Sam Merry and Pippin come rushing in as Frodo attracts the innkeeper's attention. Sam watches Pippin rise unsteadily to his feet and head to the bar while Sam indicates a brooding stranger who sits alone at a table in the far corner smoking a curiously carved longstemmed pipe and peering from beneath a travelstained cowl with gleaming eyes Frodo gestures to Butterbur while sitting at the bar and chatting with locals. Frodo leaps to his feet and pushes his way towards the bar grabbing Pippin's sleeve and spilling his beer. Frodo is then pushed into the hobbit's room by Strider who sheathes his sword with a slight smile playing on his lips. The gatekeeper comes out of his lodgings with a lantern and a look of fear on his face approaching the closed gate with great apprehension. As the gatekeeper peers out of his peephole the gate crashes down on him as four Ringwraiths ride into Bree flying down the empty streets like horsemen of the apocalypse. The front door flies open and the four Ringwraiths rush into the Prancing Pony with wicked swords drawn while Butterbur hides behind his bar trembling and sweating in terror. Pippin stirs slightly then settles back to sleep. The door creaks open and the four Ringwraiths silently slide into the hobbit's room looming above each bed and raising their shining swords above the sleeping hobbits. Sam's eyes open wide as in unison the Ringwraiths stab the hobbits in a slashing hacking frenzy. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. The Ringwraiths step back from the slashed beds in triumph but a hacked blanket is pulled back to reveal nothing but a shredded pillow. The Ringwraiths shriek with rage as Sam sits up with a start and another shredded pillow is revealed causing more shrieks of rage. Pippin and Merry wake with a start revealing that Sam Merry and Pippin have been sleeping on Strider's bed. Frodo stands next to Strider by the window peering out nervously. as furious Ringwraith screeches echo across the courtyard from the hobbits' room. Strider Merry Pippin and Frodo march through a gloomy overgrown forest as Frodo watches uneasily while Strider moves off into the cover of the trees and Sam looks excited. Strider leads the hobbits through the gloom of the forest then aerially leads Frodo. Sam Merry and Pippin across the windswept moors. The hobbits suddenly stop and unstrap their knapsacks as Strider stops casts a glance back at. Sam stares at Pippin blankly then turns away shaking his head. An apple is thrown to Merry who deftly catches it and another aimed at Pippin catches him on the forehead.

test_cases.description: The tall Bree folk loom over the nervous little hobbits as Frodo Sam Merry and Pippin make their way through the narrow streets with tall buildings towering above them and lights glowing dimly from behind thick curtains. Frodo Sam Merry and Pippin come rushing in as Frodo attracts the innkeeper's attention. Sam watches Pippin rise unsteadily to his feet and head to the bar while Sam indicates a brooding stranger who sits alone at a table in the far corner smoking a curiously carved longstemmed pipe and peering from beneath a travelstained cowl with gleaming eyes Frodo gestures to Butterbur while sitting at the bar and chatting with locals. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The gigantic penguins hover over the jittery small chipmunks as Marvin, Gus, Larry, and Ted make their way through the winding tunnels, with gigantic mushrooms looming above them and stars twinkling faintly from behind thick leaves. Marvin, Gus, Larry, and Ted come bursting in as Marvin distracts the baker's curiosity. Gus notices Ted wobble unsteadily to his paws and stroll to the fountain, while Gus points toward a musing creature who perches alone on a log in the distant alcove, chewing a peculiarly twisted stubby straw and peering from beneath a rain-soaked bonnet with glowing eyes. Marvin signals to Whiskers while lounging at the fountain and gossiping with creatures. Marvin springs upright and bursts his way towards the fountain, tugging Ted's tail and scattering his juice. Marvin is then herded into the chipmunk's attic by Skipper, who holsters his dagger with a subtle chuckle playing on his snout. The locksmith emerges from his burrow with a torch and an expression of dread on his brow, approaching the bolted tunnel with great unease. As the locksmith squints out of his peephole, the tunnel collapses on him as four Sandvipers slither into Acornville, gliding down the vacant tunnels like serpents of chaos. The main gate swings open, and the four Sandvipers glide into the Leaping Lizard with wicked daggers bared, while Whiskers ducks behind his fountain, quivering and perspiring in horror. Ted mumbles slightly, then snuggles back to slumber. The floorboard creaks open, and the four Sandvipers quietly sneak into the chipmunk's attic, looming above each hammock and raising their gleaming daggers above the dozing chipmunks. Gus's eyes snap open wide as, in harmony, the Sandvipers jab at the chipmunks in a slashing, chopping frenzy. The Sandvipers retreat from the slashed hammocks in victory, but a shredded quilt is drawn back to unveil nothing but a torn pillow. The Sandvipers hiss with fury as Gus bolts upright with a start, and another torn pillow is unveiled, inciting more hisses of fury. Ted and Larry awaken with a shock, revealing that Gus, Larry, and Ted have been napping on Skipper's hammock. Marvin stands next to Skipper by the porthole, peering out warily as furious Sandviper hisses echo across the courtyard from the chipmunks' attic. Skipper, Larry, Ted, and Marvin parade through a shadowy, tangled grove as Marvin glances nervously while Skipper slips into the canopy of the foliage, and Gus looks thrilled. Skipper guides the chipmunks through the shadow of the grove, then gracefully leads Marvin, Gus, Larry, and Ted across the gusty plains. The chipmunks suddenly pause and unsling their pouches as Skipper halts, casts a glance back at Gus, gazes at Ted blankly, then turns away, shaking his snout. A berry is tossed to Larry, who skillfully catches it, and another, aimed at Ted, bounces off his brow.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin navigate the narrow streets of Bree, overshadowed by the tall Bree folk. At the inn, Frodo attracts the attention of the locals while Sam notices a mysterious stranger named Strider. A sudden attack by Ringwraiths sends the inn into chaos, but they are thwarted when they only slash empty beds. The hobbits and Strider had moved to safety. Outside, Strider leads them through an overgrown forest and across the moors. The group pauses, with Strider briefly looking back at the hobbits. Merry catches an apple, while Pippin gets hit on the forehead with another.
